    Team News

    Juventus
    • Massimiliano Allegri will be without both Martn Cceres due to an ankle problem and, more importantly, Giorgio Chiellini, who has been ruled out with a calf injury.
    • Andrea Barzagli is a doubt but has trained this week so he should partner Bonucci in Allegri's favoured 4-3-1-2 formation.
    • Andrea Pirlo could play his last game for the club amidst reports he has agreed a move to MLS side New York City FC.
    • Fernando Llorente netted in the 2-2 draw with Verona at the weekend, though is unlikely to feature from the off, with Alvaro Morata and Carlos Tevez leading the Juventus offensive.
    Barcelona
    • Luis Enrique is sweating only on the fitness of midfielder Andres Iniesta, though the Spanish midfielder should be fit to start in Berlin.
    • Other than that, Enrique has the luxury of a fully fit squad to choose from with the Barcelona boss set to name an unchanged XI from the one that secured Copa Del Rey glory on Saturday.
    • That would see Marc-Andre ter Stegen retain his place in goal at the expense of Claudio Bravo, while Jeremy Mathieu will have to make do with a place on the bench.
    • Xavi is expected to feature in some capacity in what will be his final appearance in a Barcelona shirt having agreed to move to Qatari side Al-Sadd at the end of the season.

    Prediction

    • Juventus come into the Champions League final with morale high having secured Serie A and Coppa Italia glory this season. The Old Lady have been mightily impressive under the stewardship of Massimiliano Allegri, who can round off a memorable campaign on the highest of highs with victory over Barcelona in Berlin.
    • The Blaugrana have enjoyed a successful campaign with the 3-1 win over Athletic Club on Saturday evening confirming them as Copa Del Rey champions. They were able to add the Primera Division title to the trophy cabinet this season also, and hopes are high that they can lift their 5th European Cup this weekend.
    • The destructive trio of Lionel Messi, Luis Suarez and Neymar is likely to play a decisive factor in this encounter at the Olympiastadion, with the triumvirate breaking the 120-goal barrier between them at the weekend.
    • However, in Gianluigi Buffon, Giorgio Chiellini and Leonardo Bonucci, Juventus are built on a solid defensive threesome, though the Old Lady's backline will need to call on all the experience they can in order to limit the influence of the Barcelona offensive, especially with Chiellini now sidelined for the final.
    • However, given the performances of Barca's attack this season, that is easier said than done. The La Liga champions have been firing on all cylinders in front of goal this campaign and come into the Champions League final as slight favourites as a result.
    • Should Messi, Suarez and Neymar sing from the same hymn sheet in Berlin on Saturday, it's the Blaugrana who are tipped to be crowned champions of Europe.
    Prediction:
    Juventus
    1
    3
    Barcelona

    • [ - ] 6seconds - member since 04-Nov-12

      My favourite CL Final in recent years. Barca were favourites by far. They seemed to give credit to it with that brilliant team goal in the 5th minute, finished off by none of the MSN trio. But then Juve showed it was nought but an early lapse in concentration. Juve begun to PLAY football. Possession and momentum was theirs, from the end of the first half to right after they scored their goal. In a team with such extensive experience, and champs league winners, the drop in intensity was disappointing. The period that followed they were caught in purgatory between kwasi-intense attack and kwasi-committed defending. Barca were left with a few counters (some brilliantly defended) and of course it was Messi who would shrug off a defender before creating a goal. Tension in the game dropped here, Juve came close, but it was the home-stretch for Barca. All in all, an expectation of quality football well met. Congrats to the outgoing Xavi - 6racies. One question though - how was Iniesta MOTM??
